original_definition: 'load-frequency control block' means a part of a synchronous area or an entire synchronous area, physically demarcated by points of measurement at interconnectors to other LFC blocks, consisting of one or more LFC areas, operated by one or more TSOs fulfilling the obligations of load-frequency control;
generated_definition: 'load-frequency control block' means a system or device used to regulate the flow of electrical power between two or more circuits, typically to maintain a stable frequency in the grid.

Article 3: ‘load-frequency control block’ or ‘LFC block’ means a part of a synchronous area or an entire synchronous area, physically demarcated by points of measurement at interconnectors to other LFC blocks, consisting of one or moreLFC areas, operated by one or more TSOs fulfilling the obligations of load-frequency control;
